name: Yoshio Tabata
description: {{nihongo|'''Yoshio Tabata'''|田端義夫|Tabata Yoshio|extra=January 1, 1919 – April 25, 2013}} was a Japanese ''[[ryūkōka]]'' and ''[[enka]]'' singer, songwriter, and electric guitarist. His debut song {{nihongo|"Shima no Funauta"|島の舟唄|literally "Island Ship Song"}} was released in 1939. Along with enka-shi [[Haruo Oka]]'s 1939 debut, his debut had a big impact on Japanese popular music because Japanese popular ''[[ryūkōka]]'' music of that time was mainly sung by classical music singers such as [[Ichiro Fujiyama]] and [[Noriko Awaya]]. He was born in [[Matsusaka, Mie|Matsusaka]], [[Mie prefecture]], Japan.
